rComments: Really nice guy, taught me a lot (almost everything I know) about poetry. Lecture style isnt for everyone, but if you really listen to what hes saying you can learn a lot! Very accessible outside of classwilling to meet up after class or make an appointment anytime, and he responds to emails pretty quickly.

The kindest professor at UoftT. He is so approachable. It shows that he loves what he teaches. He made a 4th year seminar course not scary at all. He is awesome. I highly recommend taking a class with him.

Ming Xie is a lovely professor. He is friendly, approachable, mild-mannered, and pleasant to listen to. However, at times his lectures feel like they drone on longer than necessary. His voice is really relaxing, which is nice on one hand, but on the other it might put you to sleep after a late-night. Best part of the class? Barely any homework.

Professor Xie is awesome! Enjoyed his lecture though it could be a bit boring sometimes. He had interesting insights most of the time that really opened my eyes. Not a big fan of poetry before, but now I may consider taking more poetry classes with Professor Xie.
Ming is a great guy. He's kind and helpful, and always great at responding to e-mails or meeting you during office hours. Probably the lightest homework load of any class I've taken!

Ming Xie is a sweetheart, that's undeniable. You look at him and you just wanna squeeze him. Bonuses: little to NO homework, organized, insightful, open-minded to essay ideas, open book exams with unseen poems requiring little to NO prep. Downside: dry lectures, not an overly easy marker but fair.

Professor Ming Xie is the greatest! He is extremely helpful and his lectures are revelatory and illuminating! If you didn't understand the high modernists before, you certainly will once you go to his lectures. He also wrote me the kindest grad reference letter, and is extremely knowledgeable regarding a variety of thinkers. Take this class!

Lectures are very boring, believes his ideas are the only correct ideas and is too occupied with his own research that he takes over a month and a half to grade papers. If you absolutely LOVE modern poetry, then I'd recommend this class, otherwise don't waste your time.
The Best. This man knows the times and knows the rhymes.

Ming is quite insightful and is a lecturer if youre into what he's saying. Best part about this class was the freedom Prof Xie offered in writing assigments (pretty much anything you want to write on course material) and the creative opportunities offered by the poetry anthology made by the students (as suggested by Ming).Good course,light workload

Ming is a great Prof. He is very insightful and knowledgable with course content, and easy to approach. The only complaint I have is over the class atmosphere. Somedays people are very unwilling to participate and Ming is forced to make due. I think this problem stems from the fact that the class is too big and people are too shy to talk.

Ming is a brilliant and insightful expert in modernist poetry.  He delves deeply into the text and derives philosophical meaning from seemingly dry poetry. He is approachable, kind, and supportive.  Take his course, he cares about providing a positive learning experience.

ming is a great person; the lectures had much philisophical weight, he always made time to talk to students and he is very intelligent. problems were with the course itself; too much yeats, not enough pound and eliot and the time he took to return assignments was irritating. nontheless, a great learning experience.

Excellent and brilliant professor, with incredible insights into the material. He is genuinely concerned for his students, and makes an effort to accomodate them. The poetry anthology was a refreshing project and it brought the class closer together. He's one of the best in my books.

Ming is sensitive, critical, and human.  He is more a philosopher than an instructor, which makes studying under him both a pleasure and an invaluable learning experience.  With him, modern poetry becomes a source for tromendous inner insight, a portal from which one glimpses the mysteries of life.
i had a crush on him.  he's smart, quiet, patient and he really likes his work.  i think i was the only one who stayed awake, due in part to my immense crush.  i'd take another course.
Very organized, which always helps.  Also very helpful and available to students.  Lecturing style could use a bit more zip, but quite clear and easy to follow.
Great teacher who is very encouraging to his students.  Tries really hard to do a good job but sometimes his lectures are a little dull but I'm still really glad I took his class.

Professor Xie is wonderful!!! His is easy to talk to and really cares about his students. His lectures are great and he's always well prepared.  A refreshing change from other self-absorbed Profs at UofT.
No Comments
Pretty good class.  Professor Xie is a very smart guy and the curriculum is pretty good.
